former Mike Pence Jim Ryun , R-Kansas, offered his help in collecting signatures from conservatives and tea party activists to encourage Mike Pence to get into the race. Mike Pence thanked those who had encouraged him, but added: While we may have been able to seek the presidency, we believe our best opportunity to continue to serve the conservative values that brought us to public life is right here in Indiana. Richard Lugar Prather, a retired auto worker from Anderson, said after the Pendleton town hall that he believed Mike Pence 's reputation as a federal spending hawk would serve him well running for the governor's office. I think he would have been a good candidate for president, but I'm glad he didn't, Prather said.`` In the next race, he can run for president.''
